title: Angry woman spits at 11-month-old baby in buggy as mum asks her to move out of the way - Mirror Online
text:

Police are hunting a woman who allegedly spat at a baby in a pram after the mother asked her to move out of the way. 
The mother was said to have been left shocked when the woman reacted angrily to her request at a bus station. 
It was claimed the woman spat at the 11-month-old baby and then ran away. 
Police are now trying to track down the spitter and have appealed for witnesses to come forward, the Manchester Evening News reports. The mother was with her baby at the Piccadilly Gardens bus station in Manchester (Photo: MEN) 
The shocking incident occurred at the bus station in Piccadilly Gardens in Manchester city centre on Wednesday morning. Read More 
The shocked mother later reported the incident to Greater Manchester Police . 
The suspect was described as a mixed-race woman aged in her late 20s or early 30s. 
She is said to be slim and was wearing pink trainers and a dark green coat when the attack happened. 
The incident happened on a pedestrian island in the bus station at about 8.30am. Police believe there were likely several witnesses (Photo: MEN) 
The mother has told police said the incident happened as she was walking towards her bus stop and asked the woman to move so she can get by with her pram. 
It was then that the woman spat at the baby in the pram and ran away. Read More Kids ARE damaged if you fight in front of them in early years, psychologist reveals after Jeremy McConnell paternity feud 
A spokesman for Greater Manchester Police said: "It was rush-hour and so people will have seen this happen." 
The spokesman urged anyone with information about the woman to call 101, quoting incident number 420 of February 8. Like us on Facebook
